de.uni_stuttgart.ims.nlpbase.nlp

Class Sentence

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.ims.nlpbase.nlp.Sentence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Sentence>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SRLSentence

    public class Sentence
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Sentence>
    Encapsulates a sentence as a sequence of words and a dependency structure.
    Author:
    kesslewd

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sentence

        public Sentence()
        Create empty word list (only ROOT).

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(java.lang.String tokenizedString)
        Create word list with all words from the string (assume tokenized).
        Parameters:
        tokenizedString - Tokens separated by whitespace

      • Sentence

        public Sentence(Sentence otherSentence)
        Create word list with copies of all words from the sentence. (deep copy, new Word objects).
        Parameters:
        otherSentence - A different sentence.

    • Method Detail

      • addWord

        public void addWord(Word word)
        Add word to the end of word list. Give the word the id = index in the list.
        Parameters:
        word - A word that is not in the sentence yet.

      • getWordList

        public java.util.List<Word> getWordList()
        Get words (excluding ROOT).
        Returns:
        List of words in the sentence, ordered.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the sentence contains any words.
        Returns:
        TRUE if there is only the ROOT, FALSE otherwise.

      • getSentenceLength

        public int getSentenceLength()
        Returns the length of the sentence (in number of tokens).
        Returns:
        number of words in the sentence (including punctuation etc).

      • getWord

        public Word getWord(int index)
        Get word number X from the sentence. Counting starts with 1, 0 is the index of the ROOT.
        Parameters:
        index - index in the sentence.
        Returns:
        the word at that place, else null

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(Word word)
        Get index of Word in sentence. 0 is the index of the ROOT.
        Parameters:
        word - A word in the sentence.
        Returns:
        index of word or -1 if not found.

      • buildDependencyTree

        public void buildDependencyTree()
        Build dependency structure based on the head indices given in the words.

      • getDescendants

        public java.util.Set<Word> getDescendants(Word word)
        Returns all words that are in the tree below the current word. Does not include the word itself.
        Parameters:
        word - A word in the sentence.
        Returns:
        All children and all their children.

      • getPathToRoot

        public java.util.List<Word> getPathToRoot(Word word)
        Gives a list of words from the current word to the ROOT. First word in the list is always ROOT. Last word in the list is always the word itself.
        Parameters:
        word - A word in the sentence
        Returns:
        List of words from this word to the ROOT.

      • findLowestCommonAncestor

        private Word findLowestCommonAncestor(Word word1,
                                      Word word2,
                                      java.util.List<Word> word1Heads,
                                      java.util.List<Word> word2Heads)
        Find lowest common ancestor in the dependency tree of the two words given. Assumes that easy cases are already dealt with.
        Parameters:
        word1 - A word in the sentence
        word2 - A word in the sentence
        word1Heads - all words on the path from word1 to ROOT (first item is ROOT, last is word itself)
        word2Heads - all words on the path from word2 to ROOT (first item is ROOT, last is word itself)
        Returns:
        Word LCA

      • findLowestCommonAncestor

        public Word findLowestCommonAncestor(Word word1,
                                     Word word2)
        Find lowest common ancestor in the dependency tree of the two words given.
        Parameters:
        word1 - A word in the sentence.
        word2 - A word in the sentence.
        Returns:
        A word in the sentence.

      • getWordsOnPath

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<Word>> getWordsOnPath(Word word1,
                                                           Word word2)
        Path from word 1 to word 2. List contains 2 lists: 1 to go "up" to LCA 2nd to go "down"
        Parameters:
        word1 - A word in the sentence.
        word2 - A word in the sentence.
        Returns:
        Word LCA

      • compareSequence

        public int compareSequence(Word word1,
                           Word word2)
        Compares two words with respect to their sequencial order. Both words need to be in the sentence.
        Parameters:
        word1 - A word in the sentence.
        word2 - A word in the sentence.
        Returns:
        0 if the words are the same >1 if word1 is after word2 in the sentence <1 if word1 is before word2 in the sentence

      • compareTreePosition

        public Sentence.TreePosition compareTreePosition(Word word1,
                                                 Word word2)
        Compares two words with respect to their position in the tree.
        Parameters:
        word1 - A word from the sentence.
        word2 - A word from the sentence.
        Returns:
        same (same word) child (word2 is direct child of word1) descendent (word2 is somewhere below word1) parent (word2 is direct parent of word1) ancestor (word2 is somewhere on the path from word1 to ROOT) sibling (word1 and word2 have the same head) sibling_desc (word2 is a descendent of a direct sibling of word1) other (everything else)

      • isSameSentence

        public boolean isSameSentence(Sentence otherSentence)
        Check if this sentence is the same as another. Only the word forms are compared, not the analysis (not lemma, POS, depencency, ...).
        Parameters:
        otherSentence - A different sentnece.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the two sentences contain the same word forms, FALSE otherwise.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Sentence o)
        Compares two the token Strings of the two sentences lexicographically. DOES NOT COMPARE THE SYNTAX!!
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Sentence>
        Parameters:
        o - A different sentence.
        Returns:
        the value 0 if the argument sentence is equal in tokens to this string ; a value less than 0 if this string is lexicographically less than the string argument; and a value greater than 0 if this string is lexicographically greater;

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Simple representation by tokens separated by whitespace.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • wordToCoNLLString

        public java.lang.String wordToCoNLLString(Word word)
        CoNLL representation of a word from this sentence.
        Parameters:
        word - A word in the sentence.
        Returns:
        CoNLL representation (see Word.toCoNLLString)

      • printTree

        public void printTree()
        Print each word from the sentence with id and simple word representation.
